de.polygonal.ds.pooling.DynamicObjectPool<T>

type
class

An dynamic, arrayed object pool with an unbounded size that creates new objects on-the-fly and stores them for repeated use.

Use this pool if the number of objects is not known in advance.

Example:

  class Main
  {
      static function main() {
          new Main();
      }

      var _pool:de.polygonal.ds.pooling.DynamicObjectPool<Point>;

      public function new() {
          //setup the pool
          _pool = new de.polygonal.ds.pooling.DynamicObjectPool(Point);

          //setup an algorithm that runs every 100ms
          var timer = new haxe.Timer(100);
          timer.run = algorithm;
      }

      function algorithm():Void {
          //adds to points together and stores the result in c
          var a = getPoint(10, 10);
          var b = getPoint(20, 20);
          var c = addition(a, b);

          //at this point the pool has allocated three point objects;
          //we could call _pool.get() to create a new point, but instead we reuse the points we already have
          _pool.put(a);
          _pool.put(b);
          _pool.put(c);

          //no the same calculation doesn't allocate any objects
          var a = getPoint(10, 10);
          var b = getPoint(20, 20);
          var c = addition(a, b);

          //after we are done, call reclaim() to mark all objects as available for reuse in the next iteration
          _pool.reclaim();
      }

      inline function getPoint(x:Float, y:Float):Point {
          var p = _pool.get();
          p.x = x;
          p.y = y;
          return p;
      }

      inline function addition(a:Point, b:Point):Point {
          var sum = _pool.get();
          sum.x = a.x + b.x;
          sum.y = a.y + b.y;
          return sum;
      }
  }

  class Point
  {
      public var x:Float;
      public var y:Float;
      public function new() {}
  }

Constructor

new(?C : Class<T>, ?fabricate : Void -> T, ?factory : de.polygonal.ds.Factory<T>, ?capacity : Int)

parameters
C allocates objects by instantiating the class C.
fabricate allocates objects by calling fabricate().
factory allocates objects by using a Factory object (calling factory.create()).
capacity the maximum number of objects that are stored in this pool.
The default value of Limits.INT32_MAX indicates that the size is unbound.
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError invalid arguments.
Creates an empty pool.

Instance Variables

key : Int

A unique identifier for this object.
A hash table transforms this key into an index of an array element by using a hash function.
This value should never be changed by the user.

Instance Methods

inline capacity() : Int

The maximum allowed number of pooled resources.
This is an optional upper limit to counteract memory leaks.

free() : Void

Destroys this object by explicitly nullifying all objects for GC'ing used resources.
Improves GC efficiency/performance (optional).

inline get() : T

Acquires the next object from this pool or creates a new object if all objects are in use.
To minimize object creation, return objects back to the pool as soon as their life cycle ends by calling put().
If size() equals capacity(), get() still allocates a new object but does not pool it. This effectively disables pooling.

iterator() : de.polygonal.ds.Itr<T>

see
http://haxe.org/ref/iterators
Returns a new DynamicObjectPoolIterator object to iterate over all pooled objects.

inline put(x : T) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError x was returned twice to the pool (debug only).
Returns the object x to the pool.
Objects are pushed onto a stack, so get() returns x if called immediately after put().

inline reclaim() : Int

returns
The total number of allocated objects since the last call to reclaim().
Marks all pooled resources as avaiable for use by get().
The user is responsible for re-initializing an object. Don't call this method while objects are still in use or get() will return a used object.

inline size() : Int

The total number of objects in this pool.

toString() : String

Returns the string form of the value that this object represents.
